column5: So, Myself and three friends went out fishing today in search of Pike. We got out on the water by 10ish this morning and had a great time. Started the day with Ben catch a 28-30" Northern. Man, this guy makes this fish look huge lol    So After he caught that I moved out further and put my little fish finder down and was sitting at basically the same depth. Put down a fresh minnow and felt a huge *THUMP*...waited a second and layed the hook into the fish...Instantly felt alot of weight. Still not knowing why I fought this Pike for a solid 10minutes on 4lb Fluorocarbon and a #6 circle hook...no leader nothing. The sad thing is that I forgot to get a pic with the sign  Here is the result, beat my PB by 1"  31" Northern Pike!   Another Picture   Woo Hoo...shortly after that my Tip-Up goes flying up into the air, ran over and set the hook on another solid pike. Don't worry Team 2 I got a pic of this 25" Pike with the sign to get our points started!   Then it got really slow, Fish-Miester and Dave caught a handful of Perch until the evening and I landed 1 more pike...a tiny guy.  Pictures-   Dave's Perch   And the small Pike   Thought I would share my new little portable fishfinder I bought off of a member(Thanks man, it works great...still getting use to it though) Eagle Fish Easy 2   Well that's all for this evening, MTBF
don't you ever go to class!?  Great stuff man.
come on now mikey!! your PB should be 40"+ your clearly not fishing enough

I'll get there...one inch at a time. And ctdd yes I do go to class lol. I miss a lecture from time to time but my Wednesdays and Tuesdays are pretty laid back...fish all day and do a hour of homework at night.
story of your life eh!!   haha just buggin had to say it!!
Awesome Mike    Ya sure getting a great start for your first hard water season Nice gator   congrats Thanks for sharing and keep them reports coming!!! Leechman
I sure will bud. And mr Worm Dangler, enough out of you!
haha ya sorry bud!! keep up the good work!!
It was a solid day out there.
nice work! Those are some huge snowmen in the background.
